content.label: Starting off, this is a really fun game and I usually go all the way to at least Year 30, but one thing that bothers me so much is that literally every single game I develop, one of the bad events happen, I.e power/equipment failure, or ‚Äúanother country released a game like yours‚Äù this really bothers me because these events which happen every time I develop a game stunt the growth of my company, and the hurts the quality of my game

Bought this game ages ago when it first came out on the app store, i think i played it on my 4s. I fell in love with the game and spent many hours on it, then moved on to other games but came back to play the devs other games especially mega mall story. I recently redownloaded this game for the first time in many years and am once again hooked, fantastic game just as fun as i remembered.
A bunch of the things about this game are buggy. Constant ‚Äúpower outages‚Äù or ‚Äúsimilar games released‚Äù. Rating system makes no sense either.

For those calling this a clone, you remind me of the kids that said Queen copies Vanilla Ice. Or that Threes was a clone app. Check your facts. This is an oldie and a goodie. Game Dev Story just furthered the game.

That‚Äôs right, in this game, you can make a game, about making games.
That aside, after scrolling through the reviews tab many of the ‚Äúdon‚Äôt buy it, it sucks‚Äù kind of responses with no reasoning have shown up, even more disappointing is the number of ‚Äúbest game ever, just get it already‚Äù responses, so I‚Äôm here, trying to clear things up.
Game Dev Story was my second Kairosoft title, and I have to say, it‚Äôs addicting and fun when you get into to it. For my first few sessions of gameplay I focused more on the outsiders for Deving my games, using them as my 300 point crutch. As is expected by the game.
The game however, rewards strategizing game development, and insourcing your development, along with a secondary ‚Äúcontract‚Äù system for making money in the down time when you don‚Äôt have that little bit of money you need for the next game.
The Data as an XP system is really great, and the way for the employees to unlock new jobs shows a tier system that would not be expected from this sort of game.
For a game that has stayed on the App Store for so long, it really does hold up to its longevity.
As a small, pixel art, game dev tycoon, it‚Äôs inner workings are much more complex and fun than would be expected, and I can give it a full 5 star rating with no doubts.

P.S.: To make your own console you need a hardware engineer, which do not appear normally and is a job unlocked after the Producer and Director tier. To gain access your employee must have first gained level 5 in all previous positions. 

P.S.S.: The hacker position requires a level 5 hardware engineer and to get a good one you‚Äôll be paying about 20 million a year to each one, so good luck with that.

The game was a lot of fun at first, but there is no end game content. Once you get past the initial hurdles, it‚Äôs smooth sailing and there is no challenge. Once you have good workers, it doesn‚Äôt matter what type of game you make, it sells at #1. Defeats the whole point of the game.You start to amass a ton of money, and nothing to spend it on. 

It‚Äôs worth $1, but not five. Provided a day of entertainment. (Beat it twice in a 24hr period)
I have had this game for 2 days and I‚Äôm already on year 16 it‚Äôs super fun 10/10

I remembered playing this game back in elementary school... so I typed it in the App Store. I bought the game at around 10 o'clock in the morning & played. I kept playing, and playing until I saw I was in year 20. I had my phone on the charger so I wouldn't lose my progress in case my phone died. I looked at the time on my phone and saw it was 8 o'clock at night. At that moment came to a realization that I've been playing Game Dev Story for 10 hours. This game is well worth the little price that they charge, believe me. It was even difficult to write this review because I missed about 5 minutes of Game Dev time to write this. Buy the game.

title.label: Waste if money, Waste of Space

content.label: This game as someone who loves tycoons, and Game development tycoons at that, is a pretty awful game. It incosistent, painstaking, and addicting, and not in a good way. If you want a GOOD game dev tycoon game, there is many on steam for around the same price or somewhat more expensive for more enjoyment.
